note: 我很高兴地宣布，今天我们发布了Plotly.py的5.0版，我们的旗舰数据可视化图书馆！ 有关最新安装和升级说明，请参阅我们的入门文档页面，如果遇到麻烦，请查看我们的故障排除指南。 📰幽灵中的新内容.PY 5.0.0我们的官方更长的内容有详细信息和链接到个人拉出请求，但这里是亮点：⚠倒退 - 不兼容改变我们对SE的承诺......
note_en: I’m happy to announce that today we have released version 5.0 of Plotly.py, our flagship data visualization library! For up-to-date installation and upgrading instructions, please see our Getting Started documentation page and if you run into trouble, check out our Troubleshooting Guide.   📰 What’s new in Plotly.py 5.0.0 Our official changelog has details and links to individual pull requests, but here are the highlights:   ⚠ Backwards-Incompatible Changes  Our commitment to se...
title: plot LY.朋友 5.0

note:
忘记高中金融扫盲瞬间 - 美国的成年金融素养令人震惊。也许不是那么令人震惊：
 美国国债最近飙升了30万亿美元，留下养老金领取者和年轻的几代人想知道联邦政府如何履行其所有未偿还义务。如果国会甚至无法设定平衡的预算，我们其他人都有希望的希望是什么？
 负责任的联邦预算委员会主席的Maya MacGuineas最近告诉雅​​虎财务，因为这是美国的“生活水平较低”。
  与此同时，在美国成年人的一半人表示他们在财务上焦虑，超过三个季度的薪水支付。
 一个罗德岛学校是一个美好未来的方式。托尔曼高中的个人财政课程正在准备学生在世界上造成经济负责的成年人。 '21 Salutatorian Hanatha Konte在微风中告诉记者，“课程真的在我理解的方式对我打破了一切。”
 底线：教学学生的成功如何管理资金和平衡他们的家庭财政有罗德岛，通过了一个规定的条例草案，要求课堂上的所有高中家。 Gov.Dan Mckee在托尔曼高中上周三签署了法律法律。阅读更多：'Gorilla Glue Girl'：Tessica Brown发射臭名昭着的事件后几个月
note_en:
Forget high school financial literacy for a moment–– adult financial literacy in America is shockingly low. Maybe not that shocking:
 The U.S. national debt recently soared past $30 trillion, leaving pensioners and younger generations wondering how the federal government will meet all its outstanding obligations. If Congress can’t even set a balanced budget, what hope is there for the rest of us?
 Maya MacGuineas, president of the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, recently told Yahoo Finance Live that the U.S. “standard of living is lower” because of that.
  Meanwhile over half of U.S. adults say they’re financially anxious, and over three quarters live paycheck to paycheck.
 One Rhode Island school is leading the way to a better future. Personal finance classes at Tolman High School are preparing students to be financially responsible adults as they make their way in the world. Class of ‘21 salutatorian Hanatha Konte told reporters at the Breeze, “The classes really broke everything down for me in a way I understood.”
 Bottom Line: The success of teaching students how to manage money and balance their household finances has Rhode Island to pass a bill requiring the class for all high schoolers in the state. Gov. Dan McKee signed the bill into law last Wednesday at Tolman High School.   Read More:    ‘Gorilla Glue Girl’: Tessica Brown launching hair care line months after infamous incident
title: 罗德岛为高中生提供金融扫盲课程
title_en: Rhode Island Makes Financial Literacy Classes Required for High School Students

note:
最近，我一直在'发芽'狂欢！为什么所有这些都突然发芽？记住我在Moong Dal上的帖子，证明发芽降低了气体形成和其他抗营养素？那个和帖子的帖子证明发芽使你更容易吸收你身体的铁？我的意思是，我知道萌芽对你有好处;但直到现在，我没有任何证据，为什么对你有好处。一旦我看到了证据，它就会做出很大的意义。
 无论如何，所以我决定在我家里萌芽任何可用的豆科 - 小而且很大，看看会发生什么。这篇文章详细说明了我所做的，以及我从过程中学到的内容：
            （在上面的图像中，TOOR DAL没有发芽，你会看到为什么下面......）
    1）你不需要花哨的设备现在开始发芽，每个人都知道奶酪布或薄的印度毛巾技术，豆类豆类。坦率地说，我没有躺在乳酪布。湿毛巾技术是可怕的。毛巾在哪里挂在哪里？为什么触摸延长湿毛巾的概念会打扰我？这么多的问题…
  无论如何，我对你完全简单的解决方案。你有一堆外卖容器还是任何塑料大巴（酸奶容器，idli bist dabbas）藏在一些顶部架子上？你挥动螺丝刀吗？甚至是金属棒变热？只需用它们来钻出拿出容器顶部和TA-DA的孔！你自己建造了一个发芽的设备！
 另一个简单的想法：将金属蒸笼或idli / dokla板（如果您有一个）转换为Sprouter +蒸锅。将它们浸泡在底部的水中。让萌芽在顶部漏勺中排出。冲洗，重复和繁荣：1-2天后，蒸了那些小豆芽垂直！
  如果您计划不使用蒸笼1-2天进行其他活动，则此想法仅适用。 
有时会发芽可能不会发生 - 你可能已经批量批量了。也许你没有浸泡它足够长，或者也许你没有足够的水（水已经记录）等。但请不要放弃。这是一个简单的过程，就像烹饪的许多方面一样 - 一旦你得到它的悬挂 - 你会想到“这就是我所以担心的？”
 这是一批没有发芽的Toor Dal。我忘了并将其浸透了几个小时，就像较小的豆类一样。在第2天，我意识到这不会发芽。第3天和第4天确认了我的理论。
  所以，我尝试了一批新的批量 - 这次通过浸泡过夜。这个批次发芽了很好。
   这就是我发现的：即使你很长一段时间烹饪，豆芽即使也要烹饪。可以说，危机是人们对豆芽的热爱。但是，当处理大豆科豆芽时，这成为它的垮台。
 你看，我们的印度酱油用于大型豆类（黑眼豌豆，VAAL Ki Dal，全身等）需要淀粉柔软时煮熟时，当您用Chapathi或Roti舀起时，它会产生乳脂状的口感。当你做饭大豆芽2件事发生了
 1）烹饪需要很长时间的压力，将豆芽分解成柔软的糊状物（基本上消除了我总是感觉萌芽的烹饪时间优势）
    注意：我已经多次（非发芽版本）并在12分钟内轻松捣碎了这两个食谱。发芽的版本可能已经煮熟了，但除非我压力煮熟，否则没有柔软的柔软。 
将其与小豆类进行比较，即使在较少的时间煮熟和柔软时，即使在更短的时间内煮熟 - 例如在3分钟内煮熟的蛾豆。
  2）具有大发芽豆类的第二个问题 - 外涂层开始从内部摆动，因为芽沟生长。因此，酱汁将有2个漂浮在其上的不同部分 - 纤维状皮肤层和乳脂状的内部 - 然后影响口感。
  另一个问题 - 这是心理学。我们可以在原始或蒸的版本中接受吃嘎吱嘎吱的小豆类。如果他们是大豆类，那么我们开始将紧缩进入“未煮过的”豆类？并且担心我们是否会因为“未煮过的”豆芽而得到天然气。这可能只是我的问题，但这是我的观点。
  上面图片：25分钟煮熟的Toor Dal煮熟，似乎在里面煮熟，仍然很难纹理。
  在我看来，发芽是一种魔法过程，将小豆类转化为蔬菜。你的食品室里没有新鲜蔬菜，想要快速养一播种吗？不用担心，只是蒸汽和搅拌炒小豆豆豆芽（骑马，莫氏豆，蛾豆，绿色扁豆，整个马赛尔等）。
   只是一个完美，快速伴奏的ambar米！没有必要斩波（洋葱除外）!!
   我希望你在“我的实验中发现这篇文章”的豆类有用。有一段时间我宁愿饿的东西而不是吃生萌芽。 
但是，嘿，嘿，我觉得烹饪豆芽向我开辟了一个新的味道，纹理和营养的世界。 我很高兴在我的冰箱里堆积Dabbas（盒子）的冰箱为每日菜肴。 小豆类/扁豆尤其是用于发芽的优质载体。 我希望我激励你这样做。
note_en:
Recently, I have been on a ‘sprouting’ spree!! Why all this interest in sprouting suddenly? Remember my post on  Moong Dal that proved sprouting reduces gas-forming and other anti-nutrients? That and the post on  Iron absorption that proved sprouting makes it easier for you to assimilate Iron in your body? I mean, I knew sprouting was good for you; but I did not have any evidence until now as to why it was good for you. And once I saw the evidence, it made so much sense.
 Anyhow, so I decided to sprout any available legume in my house – small and large and see what happens. This post details what I did and what I learnt from the process:
            (In the image above, the toor dal has not sprouted, and you will see why down below…)
    1)  You don’t need fancy equipment to start sprouting Now, everybody know about the cheese cloth or the thin Indian towel technique to sprout their legumes. Frankly, I don’t have any cheese cloth lying around. And the damp towel technique is scary. Where will the towel hang? Why does the concept of touching a prolonged wet towel bother me? So many questions…
  Anyway, I have a totally easy solution for you. Do you have a bunch of take-out containers or any plastic dabba (Yogurt containers, idli batter dabbas) tucked away in some top shelf? Do you wield a screwdriver? Or even a metal rod made hot? Just use them to drill holes in the top of the take out container and ta-da!! you have build yourself a sprouting equipment!!
 Another simple idea: convert your metal steamer or idli/dokla plate (if you have one) into a sprouter + steamer. Soak them in water in the bottom section. Let sprouts drain in the top colander. Rinse, repeat and boom: 1-2 days later steam those tiny-sprout lings directly!!
  This idea only works if you plan to not use your steamer for 1-2 days for other activities.
  Sometimes sprouting may not happen – You may have gotten a bad batch. Maybe you did not soak it long enough, or maybe you did not drain the water enough (water logged) etc. But please don’t give up. It is a straightforward process, and just like many aspects of cooking – once you get the hang of it – you will be thinking “This is what I was so worried about?”
 Here’s a batch of toor dal that did not sprout. I forgot and soaked it only for a few hours like the smaller legumes. By day 2, I realized this is not going to sprout. Day 3 and 4 confirmed my theory.
  So, I tried a new batch – this time by soaking overnight. This batch sprouted well.
   Here’s what I found: sprouts retain a bit of crunch even if you cook them for a long time. Arguably, the crunch is what people love about sprouts. But that becomes its downfall, when dealing with large legume sprouts.
 You see, our Indian sauces for large legumes (black eye peas, vaal ki dal, whole toor, etc) need that starchy softness when cooked that gives it a creamy mouthfeel when you scoop it up with chapathi or roti. When you cook large sprouts 2 things happen
 1) It takes a long time pressure cooking it to breakdown the sprouts into a soft mush (which basically eliminates the cooking time advantage that I always felt sprouts had)
    Note: I have made these 2 recipes multiple times (the non-sprouted version) and the legumes mash easily at 12 minutes. The sprouted version may have gotten cooked, but did not get squishy soft unless I pressure cooked it more.
 Compare that to small legumes that even when sprouted gets cooked and soft enough at less time – eg moth beans cooked at 3 minutes.
  2) Second problem with large sprouted legumes – The outer coating starts to loosen from the inner part as the sprout grow. Because of this, the sauce will have 2 distinct parts floating in it – the fibrous skin layer and the creamy insides – which then affects the mouthfeel.
  Another problem – and this one is psychological. We can accept eating crunchy small legumes in its raw or steamed versions. If they are large legumes, then we start equating the crunch to ‘uncooked’ beans? And worry whether we will get gas because of the ‘uncooked’ sprouts. It might be just my problem, but this is my viewpoint.
  Above Image: Sprouted toor dal cooked at 25 min, seemed to be cooked on the inside, still hard in texture.
  Sprouting, in my opinion, is a magical process that converts the small legume into a vegetable. Have no fresh vegetables in your pantry and want to make a quick poriyal? No worries, just steam and stir fry small legume sprouts (horsegram, moong beans, moth beans, green lentils, whole masoor etc).
   Just a perfect, quick accompaniment to sambar rice!! No chopping necessary (except onions, of course)!!
   I hope you found this post on ‘My experiments with sprouting legumes’ useful. There was a time when I would rather go hungry than eat raw sprouts.
  But, hey I feel cooking sprouts opened up a new world of taste, texture and nutrition to me. I have been so happy to stack dabbas (boxes) of sprouts in my refrigerator for a daily dish. The small legumes/lentils are especially excellent vehicles for sprouting. I hope I inspired you to do the same.
title: 我用豆类豆类的实验

note:
Rhizome是纯Ruby实施的Ruby的私人刚性编译器（JIT）。它并非真正设计用于使用它。它＆＃39旨在向您展示JITS如何工作，以及为什么应该用Ruby编写的jit。它＆＃39; s还旨在尝试超出一个简单的模板编译器的微不足道的方面，即jits经常显示的简单模板编译器 - 而是有一个适当的中间表示（IR），并显示了降低和调度程序等编译器的高级部分的更高级部分工作，人们通常覆盖。
 无营养的根茎是一个我从未完成过的一面停滞不前的项目。存储库的当前状态就像我离开它一样。
    有实验和文件。实验是展示系统的一部分工作的小程序，通常会将图形作为输出产生，并且文档更深入地解释了一些深度，以及读者的一些引用和一些想法。
 运行实验运行Bundle Exec实验/ foo.rb。它＆＃39; ll要么显示一些输出，也可以生成图表。然后也读它。
   我非常抱歉它＆＃39;没有更加抛光！希望你能得到一些东西。
note_en:
Rhizome is a paedagogical just-in-time compiler (JIT) for Ruby, implemented in pure Ruby. It's not really designed to be used. It's designed to show you how JITs work and why perhaps a JIT for Ruby should be written in Ruby. It's also designed to try to go beyond the trivial aspects of a simple template compiler that introductions to JITs often show - instead it has a proper intermediate representation (IR) and shows how more advanced parts of compilers such as lowering and schedulers work, that people don't usually cover.
 Unforutnately Rhizome was a stalled side-project that I never finished. The current state of the repository is as I left it off.
    There are  experiments and  documents. The experiments are little programs that show you how one part of the system works, often generating graphs as output, and the documents explain things in more depth with some references and some ideas for readers.
 To run an experiment run  bundle exec experiments/foo.rb. It'll either show some output or will generate a graph. Then also read it.
   I'm very sorry it's not more polished! Hopefully you can get something out of it.
title: 根茎 -  Ruby的Jit，在纯Ruby中实施
title_en: Rhizome – a JIT for Ruby, implemented in pure Ruby

note:
有些人倾向于避免更新其PC的主要原因之一是“它使它变慢”。特别是Windows 10的软件作为服务方法，在那里每年获得两次所谓的“功能更新”。但它实际上是真的吗？
 今天，我们会发现Windows 10的表现随着时间的推移，通过基准测试的操作系统体验：
  但首先，一点点免责声明：虽然我尽力尽可能地将性能指标进行比较，但在测量中可能有一些防滑。出于本实验的目的，我使用Hyper-V作为选择的管理程序，具有4GB的RAM，4个核心和每个构建的32GB固定磁盘。
    设置过程是最终用户的首先入侵OS体验。在最后一个Windows版本（特别是Vista和更高版本），Microsoft在确保Windows安装尽可能平稳且高效方面取得了重大进步。但它有多快？
 对于每个构建，我确保我使用了使用.wim格式的安装映像，以实现一致和准确的结果。此外，为了客观地比较速度并尽可能少地减少人为错误，利用无人看管的文件。
  正如我们所看到的，在前3个公共版本的Windows 10中，结果非常一致。但是，在创建者更新后，我们可以看到大约3分钟的增加。然而，峰值是2018年10月10日的Windows 10（构建17763），安装需要18分钟和40秒。在RS5之后，似乎安装过程有点快速，但与RS2构建的构建相同。
 判断：Windows 10的设置过程确实有点慢，但不是戏剧性的程度。这可能是由于后续版本的Windows 10使用更多磁盘空间，这显然转化为更长的写入时间。 
OS中最有基准的性能区域之一是启动速度。它设置了整体性能的音调，作为一种慢慢靴子的系统很可能也会慢慢地运行。由于Windows 8，引导过程已被显着更改*以利用现代存储设备，如SSD。 *  - 出于此测量的目的已禁用快速启动功能。
  正如我们所看到的，因为Windows 10周年更新以来，启动时间确实增加了很大。 （创作者更新中有一个明显的DIP）。如果我们将Windows 10 Th1与Windows 10 20H1进行比较，我们的增加约为2.6倍。当然，在这种情况下，只有几秒钟的问题，但在较慢的系统上，它肯定会变得更加明显。
   判决：靴子时间实际上已经慢得慢，后续建造。这可能是由在较新的Windows中实现的新安全技术引起的，以及推出的新服务。
  虽然微软试图使他们的UWP应用程序作为未来，但到这一天，Win32仍然是Windows ... Windows。
 我选择该基准测试的应用程序是所有收件箱Windows应用程序：Windows资源管理器，Winver，记事本，Internet Explorer，Painter，Registry，Registry编辑器，Msconfig，Msinfo32，WordPad，Control Panel和Task Manager。
  同样，我们可以看到，我们有一个非常重要的放缓，从Windows 10 1809开始，与以前的构建有两倍。再次，如果我们比较最高点的最低点，我们的差异超过3次。不是好看。
   Universal Windows平台（或者是，根据您要求谁）Microsoft的应用程序平台为“一个Windows”愿景。 UWP应该促进应用程序的开发，因此人们可以编写一次应用程序，然后它将在一流的设备上运行。不幸的是，UWP处于一个尴尬的位置，这些尴尬的位置是微软，在商店中可以特别看到的东西。 
基准的应用程序是：Microsoft Edge，设置，计算器，日历，地图，电影和电视，Groove音乐，人，商店和录音机
  我们在这方面有一些非常戏剧性的结果。再次，从1809年开始，事物发出大幅恶化，峰值与19h1有峰值。结果不可能更清楚。
   出于本实验的目的，我使用Windows搜索在C：Drive中查找Msinfo32的所有实例。让我们检查结果：
  在这里，与我们的其他基准不同，结果疯狂地变化，所以我们不能肯定会说我们有回归。
   对于此测试，我使用了adeltax的regDi32基准，它创建了9900 GDI处理，恰好低于10000的最大阈值。该程序基准测试所有句柄所需的时间。让我们来看看：
  正如我们所看到的，我们的增长稳步增长，直到Windows 10 19h1结束了20h1的戏剧性下降。所以，它看起来像是在GDI表现上发生的事情是幸运的，这是一个清爽的景象。
 判决：GDI性能用于随着每个后续版本越来越慢，但它得到了固定。 
对于此基准测试，我创建了一个非常简单的批处理脚本，它打开文件资源管理器的实例，直到GDI耗尽。此测试不仅测试了GDI渲染速度，还可以进行Win32开放时间。看到视觉伪像越快，越快。
  我们再次与Windows 10 1809开始的时间重大增加。虽然我们在前一段中看到GDI性能大大提高了20H1，但它仍然没有帮助在减少耗尽之前的时间。因此，我们可以得出结论，延长时间是由Win32 App开放速度较低的。
 判决：开设足够的资源管理器实例需要更多时间，即操作系统将从GDI处理中脱离。
  无论我们喜欢它还是讨厌它，Windows Defender都已成为具有Windows的越来越集成的零件，每个功能更新都会添加新的改进。但是做好旧的快速扫描怎么样？让我们看看它是否变慢或更快：
  看起来像周年纪念更新，扫描速度得多得多，而较新的构建具有不同的结果，它们仍然比Windows 10的前两个版本好得多。
 判决：Windows Defender不仅更智能，但与Windows 10的初始版本相比，它也很快。
  对于此基准测试，我使用了DISKSPD，这是Microsoft提供的免费开源实用程序，用于测试I / O子系统性能。 
在事件的有趣转向中，Windows 10 1809实际上是整个群体的最快版本。看起来Microsoft对I / O子系统进行了一些改进，因为这些变化持续到下一个版本。
   最后，但并非最不重要的是，我们无法在不测量关断速度的情况下完成基准测试操作系统体验。虽然总体而言并不重要，但它仍然给了我们对整个操作系统韧性的印象。
   判决：结果在电路板上非常一致，这意味着关闭速度是宽线的。
  好吧，那种。但是，大多数人不会注意到这种回归。我们还看到了I / O部门的一些显着改进，以及安全性。
  我们可以责备可能导致这种回归的很多事情。有些人可能会说微软的移动设备失去的兴趣使它们不会像对待其最大绩效的整理组件一样警惕（如你的一些可能知道，即使在低端硬件上也赞扬了Windows手机的优异性能。其他可能将责任归咎于增强安全窗口。在互联网上轻松获得病毒的日子已经一去不复返了，因为Windows Defender对最终用户能够在Ownive时掌握了更长的掌握。
 如果您想看到一些采取的一些基准的视频演练，您可以在此处查看：
note_en:
One of the main reasons some people tend to avoid updating their PCs is that “it makes it slower”. Especially with Windows 10’s Software as a Service approach, where it gets the so-called “feature updates” twice a year. But is it actually true?
 Today we’re gonna find out how much Windows 10’s performance has changed over time, by benchmarking 10 elements of the OS experience:
  But first, a little disclaimer: although I tried the best I could to compare the performance metrics as objectively as possible, there might have been some slip-ups in the measurements. For the purposes of this experiment I used Hyper-V as the hypervisor of choice, with 4GB of RAM, 4 cores and a 32GB fixed disk for each build.
    The setup process is the end user’s first incursion into the OS experience. Over the last Windows versions (specifically Vista and later), Microsoft has made major strides in ensuring that the Windows installation is as smooth and efficient as possible. But how fast is it?
 For each build, I made sure that I used an installation image that uses the .WIM format, for consistent and accurate results. Also, for objectively comparing speeds and reducing the human error to as little as possible, an unattended file was utilized.
  As we can see, during the first 3 public release of Windows 10 the result is pretty consistent. However, after Creators Update, we can see an increase with about 3 minutes. The peak, however, is with Windows 10 October 2018 update (build 17763), where the installation takes a whopping 18 minutes and 40 seconds. After RS5, it seems that the installation process is a bit speedier, but not at the same level as the pre-RS2 builds.
 Verdict: Windows 10’s setup process did get a bit slower, but not to a dramatic extent. This might be caused by the fact that subsequent releases of Windows 10 use more disk space, which obviously translates into longer write times.
  One of the most benchmarked areas of performance in an OS is the boot speed. It sets the tone in overall performance, as a system that boots slowly will most likely also run slow. Since Windows 8, the boot process has been significantly changed* to take advantage of modern storage devices such as SSDs.  * – the fast boot feature has been disabled for the purposes of this measurement.
  As we can see, the boot time did increase quite dramatically since Windows 10 Anniversary Update. (with a noticeable dip in Creators Update). If we compare Windows 10 TH1 with Windows 10 20H1, we have an increase of about 2.6 times. Of course, in this context it’s only a matter of mere seconds, but on a slower system it is definitely going to be a lot more noticeable.
   Verdict: The boot times did in fact get slower with subsequent builds. This is probably caused by the new security technologies implemented in newer builds of Windows, as well as the new services introduced.
  Although Microsoft tried to make their UWP apps as the future, to this day Win32 is still what makes Windows… Windows.
 The apps I chose for this benchmark are all inbox Windows apps: Windows Explorer, winver, Notepad, Internet Explorer, Paint, Registry Editor, msconfig, msinfo32, Wordpad, Control Panel and Task Manager.
  Again, we can see that we have a pretty significant slowdown starting with Windows 10 1809, being twice as slow as the previous build. Again, if we compare the lowest point with the highest, we have a difference of more than 3 times. Not a good look.
   Universal Windows Platform is (or was, depending on who you ask) Microsoft’s application platform for their “One Windows” vision. UWP is supposed to facilitate app development, so that one can write an app once, and then it would run on a plethora of devices. Unfortunately nowadays, UWP is in an awkward position of being somewhat neglected by Microsoft, thing that can especially be seen in the Store.
 The apps that were benchmarked are: Microsoft Edge, Settings, Calculator, Calendar, Maps, Movies and TV, Groove Music, People, Store and Voice Recorder
  We have some pretty dramatic results in this area. Again, things worsened dramatically starting with 1809, with the peak being with 19H1. The results couldn’t be more clear.
   For the purpose of this experiment, I used Windows Search to find all instances of msinfo32 in the C: drive. Let’s check the results:
  Here, unlike our other benchmarks, the results are varying wildly, so we can’t say for sure that we have a regression.
   For this test I used ADeltaX’s REGDI32 benchmark, which creates 9900 GDI handles, just below the maximum threshold of 10000. This program benchmarks the time it takes to render all the handles. Let’s take a look:
  As we can see, we had a steady growth until Windows 10 19H1, which ended with a dramatic drop with 20H1. So, it looks like whatever was going on with the GDI performance was fortunately fixed, which is a refreshing sight.
 Verdict: GDI performance  used to get slower with each subsequent release, but it got fixed.
  For this benchmark I created a very simple batch script which opens instances of File Explorer until GDI depletion. This tests not only the GDI rendering speed, but also Win32 opening times. The faster it takes to see visual artifacts, the better.
  We have yet again a major increase in time starting with Windows 10 1809. Although we saw in the previous segment that GDI performance was dramatically improved with 20H1, it still didn’t help all that much in reducing the time until depletion. As such, we can conclude that the prolonged time is caused by Win32 app opening speed being lower.
 Verdict: It takes more time to open enough Explorer instances that the OS will be out of GDI handles.
  Whether we love it or hate it, Windows Defender has become a more and more integrated part with Windows, each feature update adding new improvements to it. But what about doing an good old quick scan? Let’s see if it got slower or faster:
  Looks like after Anniversary Update, the scan speed got much faster, and while newer builds have varying results, they are still much better than the first two releases of Windows 10.
 Verdict: Windows Defender not only got smarter, but it also is a lot faster compared to initial releases of Windows 10.
  For this benchmark I used diskspd, which is a free, open-source utility provided by Microsoft for testing the I/O subsystem performance.
    In an interesting turn of events, Windows 10 1809 is actually the fastest of the whole bunch of builds. It looks like Microsoft did some improvements to the I/O subsystem, as these changes persisted over to the next releases.
   Last, but not least, we can’t finish benchmarking the OS experience without measuring the shutdown speed. Although not that important overall, it still gives us an impression of the whole OS tenacity.
   Verdict: The results are pretty consistent across the board, which means that the shutdown speed is in broad lines the same.
  Well, kind of. However, most of the people will not notice this regression. We have also seen some notable improvements in the I/O department, as well as security.
  We can blame a lot of things that may have caused this regression. Some might say the lost interest for mobile devices by Microsoft made them not as vigilant in fine-tuning every component to its maximum performance (as some of you might know, Windows Phones were praised for their excellent performance, even on low end hardware). Other might put the blame on the enhanced security Windows has nowadays. Gone are the days where one might get viruses easily from the internet, as Windows Defender has an ever-growing grip on the end user’s ability to modify the OS as they please.
 If you want to see a video walkthrough of some of the benchmarks taken, you can check it right here:
title: Windows的状态，第2部分：Windows 10与每个功能更新慢下来？
title_en: State of the Windows, part 2: Did Windows 10 slow down with each feature update?
